newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Bulog chief sees low Indonesian inflation in Oct.
newsitem.headline: Bulog chief sees low Indonesian inflation in Oct.

text.p: Indonesia's Logistic Bureau (Bulog) chairman Beddu Amang said on Monday he expected a low level of inflation in the country in October.
"I think the consumer price index increase will be low in October. Food prices seem to be slightly higher, but inflation is still under control," Amang told Reuters.
Indonesia's consumer price index declined 0.04 percent month-on-month in September, compared with a rise of 0.27 percent in August.
Indonesia is expected to announce the inflation figures on November 6. Bulog is Indonesia's commodities regulator.
